paper_abstract: A new classification of arbitrary cellular automata (CA for short) in Z(d) is studied considering the set (group) of all permutations of the neighborhood. and state set Q. Two CA (Z(d), Q, f(A), nu(A)) and (Z(d), Q, f(B), nu(B)) are called automorphic, if there is a pair of permutations (pi, phi) of nu and Q, respectively, such that (f (B), nu(B)) = (phi(-1) f(A)(pi)phi, nu(pi)(A)), where nu(pi) denotes a permutation of nu and f(pi) denotes a permutation of arguments of local function f corresponding to nu(pi). This automorphism naturally induces a classification of CA, such that it generally preserves the global properties of CA up to permutation. As a typical example of the theory, the local functions of 256 ECA (1-dimensional 3-nearest neighbors 2-states CA) are classified into 46 classes. We also give a computer test of surjectivity, injecitivity and reversibility of the classes.
